choices.C: Set up card-reader access to secure the server room
choices.D: Move the servers to a different location
choices.B: Place servers in a rack or cabinet with a lock

discussion.content: Camera can prevent. Knowing there is a camera will discourage/prevent a lot of thieves

comments.content: I definitely agree with B and C because the question specifically asks how to secure the server room. Have locked racks in the server room is a must for physical security. The card access to the server room would be the 2nd option that will prevent unauthorized access.

discussion.content: I think the answer is B and C. Agree, cameras cannot prevent stolen timely, so E is definitely not the answer.

Answer should be A & C. 
E. Install cameras in the building has nothing to do with preventing a physical security breach. Cameras are merely a deterrent and for investigations.

questions.question_text: Two servers were stolen from a small business with limited physical security. Which of the following are the BEST methods to prevent physical security breaches of the server room? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Move the OS installer to a different USB port
choices.C: Change the boot order to PXE

questions.question_text: The server administrator is installing a new server. When booting up the server, the OS installer is unable to find any disk to load the OS. Which of the following should the server administrator perform to solve this issue?

discussion.content: If the “OS installer” is unable to find any disk to load the OS, then it doesn’t matter if you boot from pxe, usb, dvd, etc. The disk is not present. Answer should be A configure the raid controller to make the disk available. Thoughts?

“ On Wednesday, it is discovered that the data loaded into the database on Monday is corrupted, and the database needs to be restored from Sunday’s backup.
There’s no correct answer because the answer is in the question “restored from Sunday’s backup”. 
This is a screwed up question.
The correct answer is D. No snapshot was taken, and the restore should not affect updates so only the DB should be restored.
The corrupted data is installed on Monday. If restoring from Tuesday, does the corrupt data not remain there? Should the correct answer be D?

choices.A: Restore the differential backup from Tuesday
choices.D: Restore the database backup from Monday
choices.C: Restore the server from Tuesday's snapshot
choices.B: Restore the server from Saturday's full backup

questions.question_text:
A database server is configured with the database files residing on a separate partition to meet vendor recommendations. The following schedule is used for system backup:
✑ Full backup Saturday at 12:00 a.m.
✑ Differential backup daily Sunday through Friday at 12:00 a.m.
✑ Database backups daily at 12:00 a.m.
New data is loaded into the database on Monday night, and OS patches are installed on Tuesday night. On Wednesday, it is discovered that the data loaded into the database on Monday is corrupted, and the database needs to be restored from Sunday's backup.
Which of the following backup types would BEST allow restoration of the database without affecting the OS patches installed on Tuesday?

An administrator is creating an on-site backup and an off-site backup for four servers located at the company's headquarters. Which of the following backup options should the administrator select to meet the requirements?

choices.C: A daily backup of each server to a SAN volume at the headquarters and a weekly backup to a NAS drive at a colocation
choices.B: An hourly backup of each server to a NAS drive at the MDF and a nightly backup to another NAS drive at the IDF of the headquarters
choices.D: A continuous replication backup to the NAS drive in the server room and a nightly backup to the backup server at the HQ telecom closet
choices.A: A daily backup of each server to its secondary disks and a nightly cross-backup to the network drives of one of the other servers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This option ensures that there are both on-site and off-site backups, fulfilling the requirements of having an on-site backup (for rapid recovery) and an off-site backup (for disaster recovery purposes).

comments.content:
Yap the requirement is just "backup for four servers located at the company's headquarters"
Its hard to choose answer with limit requirement.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
type1 = bare metal = physical level

Selected Answer: C
why A and not C?

choices.B: Type 1 hypervisor operates at the OS level
choices.A: Type 1 hypervisor operates at the physical level
choices.D: Type 2 hypervisor operates at the data link layer
choices.C: Type 2 hypervisor operates at the physical level

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the difference between a Type 1 and a Type 2 hypervisor?
